repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fixes #24032

Somehow, `file://` is a wrong one?  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_URI_scheme#How_many_slashes?


Changelog:
* Added more test cases and also have windows example. 
* Not handling `file://` as it is based on a host. 
* Handling hexcode on Windows; %A3 -> `;`

comment_data.body:
`strncmp` avoids false positives, but it doesn't hurt to be extra clear for others reading the code.

```suggestion
        if (strncmp(*file_to_find, "file:/", 6) == 0) {
```

```suggestion
  it('finds "file://" URI on the local filesystem #24032', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,14 @@ describe('file search', function()
     eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))
   end)
 
+  it('find file name with prefix `file://` in line #24032', function()

comment_data.body: the test treats `file://foo` as `foo`, but the comment here implies that it's treated as `/foo` ?

need tests for `file:///` also. and other edge cases like `https://example.com/file:/foo.txt` . 

see also https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-uri/blob/53e4ca6263f2e4ddc35f5360c62bc1b1d30f27dd/src/test/uri.test.ts#L264-L268

and just to confirm, it looks like [this](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-uri/blob/53e4ca6263f2e4ddc35f5360c62bc1b1d30f27dd/src/test/uri.test.ts#L82-L84) and [this](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-uri/blob/53e4ca6263f2e4ddc35f5360c62bc1b1d30f27dd/src/test/uri.test.ts#L153-L174) is telling us that the first thing after `file://` is the "authority". Thus `file:///foo` is the absolute path `/foo` (with `authority=''`) whereas `file://foo` has no path (with `authority='foo'`).

so the test in this PR currently isn't correct.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,14 @@ describe('file search', function()
     eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))
   end)
 
+  it('find file name with prefix `file://` in line #24032', function()
+    command('cd test/functional/fixtures')
+    insert('file://filename_with_unicode_ααα')
+    eq('', eval('expand("%")'))
+    feed('gf')
+    eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))

comment_data.body:
Added the test and not handling `file://` (also added test cases for each of them)

PTAL
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,14 @@ describe('file search', function()
     eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))
   end)
 
+  it('find file name with prefix `file://` in line #24032', function()
+    command('cd test/functional/fixtures')
+    insert('file://filename_with_unicode_ααα')
+    eq('', eval('expand("%")'))
+    feed('gf')
+    eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))

comment_data.body: try to use positive confirmation (eq instead of neq), it results in must better failure messages and avoids false successes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +105,36 @@ describe('file search', function()
     eq('filename_with_unicode_ααα', eval('expand("%:t")'))
   end)
 
+  it('finds "file:[/|///]" URI on the local filesystem #24032', function()
+    local function test_gf(input, expected)
+      command('%delete')
+      insert(input)
+      command('norm! 0')
+      feed('gf')
+      eq(expected, eval('expand("%:p")'))
+    end
+
+    test_gf("file:/a", "/a")
+    test_gf("file:/foo/bar/slash.txt", "/foo/bar/slash.txt")
+    test_gf("file:///foo/bar/3slashes.txt", "///foo/bar/3slashes.txt")
+    test_gf("file:/c:/test/window/slash.txt", "/c:/test/window/slash.txt")
+    test_gf("file:///c:/test/window/3slash.txt", "///c:/test/window/3slash.txt")
+    test_gf("http://foo/bar/file:/with/url", "http://foo/bar/file:/with/url")
+
+    -- Don't handle `gf file://`
+    command('%delete')
+    insert("file://host/foo/bar/2slashes.txt")
+    command('norm! 0')
+    feed('gf')
+    neq("//host/foo/bar/2slashes.txt", eval('expand("%:p")'))

comment_data.body:
is there any system besides KDE which has the single-slash variant? 

is there a [vscode test](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-uri/blob/53e4ca6263f2e4ddc35f5360c62bc1b1d30f27dd/src/test/uri.test.ts#L264-L268) which asserts this? 

please add a reference in this docstring, I guess https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_URI_scheme#Number_of_slash_characters is fine.

> is there any system besides KDE which has the single-slash variant?

Seems like this might be a good guide; http://eed3si9n.com/encoding-file-path-as-URI-reference/

Unix: u1/u3 `file:/` and `file:///`
Windows: u0/u3 `file:` and `file:///` (But, it seems like currently, neovim supports `

But, I don't know how to find if other system uses single-slash variant.  (googled a bit, but it leads to irrelevant stuff)

> is there a vscode test

This is trickier than I have thought before, as `:`(`0x3A`) and ` ` (`0x20`) are not allowed in file_path, Windows/DOS seems to convert those into hex code and Neovim needs to handle this case. 

For this one, it seems that `vim.uri_to_fname`([ref](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/eadedfd9084c338a9162ef3706756bda443d6559/runtime/lua/vim/uri.lua#L102)) is available for file URI conversion, from lua side, but none seems to exist on C side? (I don't know if I'm understanding this correctly)

One thought is that it would be nice if c library side handles URIs nicely like lua side does. 


> please add a reference in this docstring, I guess https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_URI_scheme#Number_of_slash_characters is fine.

Done.

comment_regular_data.body:
Oops, apparently, I don't know how to git smh

Trying to rebase from master :(
Still interested in this, but probably want to move the logic to Lua, possibly using `vim.fs`.

title: feat: handle "file:/" and "file:///" for 'gf' command
